Introduction to Programming Using Python

The following are the topics for Fall 2020. We will be linking to Jupyter Notebooks for these topics as they become available:

  • Introduction to Karel
  • Karel - Functions/Control structures (if statement)
  • Karel - Functional decomposition
  • Karel - Program style/Control structures (while loops)
  • Input/Output, Variables, Values
  • Types
  • Operators
  • Expressions
  • Turtle graphics
  • For loops
  • Function parameters and the return statement
  • Strings I
  • Strings II
  • Using modules and Variable scope
  • Lists and Tuples I
  • Lists and Tuples II
  • Type conversion
  • Command-line arguments
  • Files, File I/O, and Exceptions I
  • Files, File I/O, and Exceptions II
  • Sets
  • Dictionaries I
  • Dictionaries II
  • Binary representation and other number systems
  • Object-Oriented Programming
  • OOP: Classes and objects I
  • OOP: Classes and objects II
  • OOP: Attributes and methods
  • List and Dictionary Comprehensions
